metadata.title: CVE-2017-5018 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Google Chrome prior to 56.0.2924.76 for Linux, Windows and Mac, and56.0.2924.87 for Android, had an insufficiently strict content securitypolicy on the Chrome app launcher page, which allowed a remote attacker toinject scripts or HTML into a privileged page via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5018` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
chromium-browser-l10n - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
chromium-chromedriver - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268').
